home.title: Wayfarers of the South Tigris Solo Helper
home.play1: Play Wayfarers of the South Tigris solo against the AI.
home.play2: This application replaces scheme cards, manages most of the AI player board and guides you through the game and solo ruleset. It supports all AI focuses.
home.play3: You can also play with the Tides of Trade expansion.

botFocusSelection.title: AI Focus
botFocusSelection.feelDifferent: Each AI Focus will feel different to play against.

instructions.intro: Setup the game for a 2-player game, with the following changes for the AI:
instructions.aiBoard: On the backside of the player boards you find the AI sides. Find the board with this symbol ({focus} focus):
instructions.noDice: The AI is not using any Dice.
instructions.playerMarker: Place the Player Marker of their colour on the starting space of the Journal Track.
instructions.workers: They start with 1 Yellow Worker and 1 Blue Worker.
instructions.secondPlayer: The AI will always be the 2nd player. They do not gain any Provisions or Silver, but do start the game with 1 Influence in the Yellow Guild and 1 in Blue. Place their remaining Influence into their supply.
instructions.noSchemeCards: The AI does not need the scheme cards - the card deck, the AI resource track and the comet track is managed by this application.

ruleChanges.title: Rule Changes
ruleChanges.influenceLimits: Influence Limits: Unlike human players, the AI is not limited by the Influence in their supply. If they run out, use Influence of an unused colour. This is still considered to be their Influence.
ruleChanges.costs: The AI ignores all costs (other than those on their Scheme Cards), and ignores all requirements on the Journal Track. They still gain all rewards from the Journal Track. In the final column, they gain a Pink Upgrade, not an Inspiration Card.
ruleChanges.icons: The AI ignores all icons on all Cards and Upgrade Tiles they acquire. This includes Comets, Influence, free Upgrades, etc - everything! However, they do still gain Victory Points from acquired Upgrade Tiles.
ruleChanges.resourceTrack: The AI resolves all icons on the Resource Track just as a player would. Along the top of the AI Board are shown some key changes to certain icons. If they would ever gain the effect on the left, they instead resolve that shown on the right.

general.spendInfluencePossible: If it cannot spend the indicated Influence, the action is not possible.
general.gainInfluence: The AI places the indicated Influence on Guild(s).

comet.title: Comet
comet.instruction: The AI gains 1 Comet (managed by the application).

influenceCard.title: Influence Card
influenceCard.instruction: The AI places 1 Influence on a Card. Choose by colour and card priority.

journal.title: Journal
journal.moveJournalTrack: The AI advances on the Journal Track. If it has a choice, it follows the direction of the arrow.
journal.lastColumn: When moving into the last column of the Journal Track, the AI will never take the middle option. If you blocked the space they would have moved into, they instead move into the other available space in that final column. For the final space of the Journal Track, they will take a Special Upgrade Tile, not an Inspiration Card.
journal.additionalStepPriority: Before Journaling, first check to see where the AIâ€™s Player Marker is in reference to your own. If they are behind, they will spend 1 Black Influence to move an extra space if possible. If they are in the same column, this will cost 2 Black Influence, and if they are ahead, this will cost 3 Black Influence. Note that it is possible for them to gain the required Black Influence during their first movement. However, it is their position before that first movement that dictates the Influence cost. They will only move a 2nd time if they have the required Black Influence available to spend.

upgradeTile.title: Upgrade Tile
upgradeTile.instruction: The AI gains 1 Upgrade Tile (green, black, yellow or blue - according to the colour preference).

upgradeTileWorker.title: Worker Upgrade Tile
upgradeTileWorker.instruction: The AI gains 1 Worker Upgrade Tile.

worker.title: Place Worker
worker.placeWorker: The AI places 1 Worker of the indicated colour (if available in their supply).
worker.workerColors: The AI will only ever place Green Workers on Townsfolk Cards, Yellow Workers on Land Cards, and Blue Workers on Water Cards.
worker.printedActions: They resolve all printed actions of a space when placing a Worker.
